description:
When a network subnet runs out of IP addresses a request to create a VM on that network fails with the Error message: "No valid host was found. There are not enough hosts available."
In the nova logs the error message is: NoMoreFixedIps: No fixed IP addresses available for network.

Nova should propagate the right error message reported by Neutron.
title: wrong error message when no IP addresses are available

comments.content:
When a network subnet runs out of IP addresses a request to create a VM on that network fails with the Error message: "No valid host was found. There are not enough hosts available."
In the nova logs the error message is: NoMoreFixedIps: No fixed IP addresses available for network.

Nova should propagate the right error message reported by Neutron.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~emagana

comments.content:
Hi Edgar Magana,

Are you still working on this bug?If not I would like to propose a fix for it.

Thanks,
Vijaya
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vijaya-erukala

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/145460
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/145460
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=1dfc30865ee899f654a511e9cd8612945aec5421
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 1dfc30865ee899f654a511e9cd8612945aec5421
Author: Vijaya Erukala <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Jan 6 18:33:29 2015 +0530

    Fix error message when no IP addresses available.
    
    If a network subnet runs out of IP addresses while creating a port
    for the VM, neutron will throw NoMoreFixedIps exception, this exception
    is no where handled in nova. This patch will handle the exception to
    show the proper error message.
    
    Closes-Bug: 1394268
    Change-Id: I85343706f926ceaec15a964eceeb44669f993a4e
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
